DataElement.preferredName: Patient Imaging Procedure Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response as to whether all eligibility criteria addressing imaging procedures were met in order for the patient to participate in the clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Imaging Technique Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Imaging Technique Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient meet all of t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient meet all of the clincial trial protocol eligibility criteria addressing the imaging procedures?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ALT - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient received a FDG PET/CT scan on an ACRIN qualified scanner and according to protocol parameters within 28 days prior to registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EA1141 EC
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient undergo breast ultrasound within 12 months prior to randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: E4112EC
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a two-view (full view CC and a full view MLO) mammogram of both breasts within 6 months of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the participant suitable to undergo MRI and receive gadolinium-based contrast agent (no severe, untreatable claustrophobia; no MRI-incompatible metallic objects and implanted medical devices; no renal failure; no weight greater than allowable by scanner per institutional standard practice)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were all disease/imaging studies, if applicable, obtained within 21 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were disease/staging imaging studies to determine eligibility performed within 3 days prior to enrollment and within 28 days prior to the projected surgery date?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were all disease/staging imaging studies, if applicable, obtained within 21 days prior to enrollment and start of protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were disease/staging imaging studies to determine eligibility performed within 21 days prior to enrollment and start of protocol therapy (repeat if necessary)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior to neoadjuvant therapy, is the patientâ€™s primary tumor less than or equal to 3cm by imaging studies, with negative axillary nodes (cN0) based on axillary U/S, CT, PET or MRI?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior to neoadjuvant therapy, is the primary tumor less than or equal to 3cm by imaging studies, with negative axillary nodes (cN0) based on axillary U/S, CT, PET or MRI?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients with visible pelvic sidewall nodes on MRI.

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
